top_categories.workout_context: Heywood Ride's Minnesota rolling gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Heywood Ride's Minnesota rolling, Local event forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 50 miles.
50 miles on Minnesota rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Heywood Ride. Train it until it feels boring.
At Heywood Ride, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Heywood Ride's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
Base fitness for Heywood Ride. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
When someone attacks on Minnesota rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Heywood Ride, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Varied gradients on Minnesota rolling gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
The aerobic base that lets you ride Minnesota rolling gravel at tempo for 50 miles without cracking. No shortcuts.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Heywood Ride’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Heywood Ride requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on minnesota rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: minnesota rolling, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Durability to prepare you for 50 miles of minnesota rolling gravel in Northfield, Minnesota.
